com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.servlet

Class HttpServletHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.container.AbstractContainerHelper
      • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.servlet.HttpServletHelper
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    WServlet.WServletHelper

    public class HttpServletHelper
extends AbstractContainerHelper
    A servlet specific ContainerHelper.

    Chiefly it handles the creation and storage of each users UIContext in the servlet session, and it maps servlet requests and responses to wcomponent requests and responses.

    An instance is created each request being processed.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Jonathan Austin

      • redirectForLogout

        protected void redirectForLogout()
        Redirects the client to a URL after the log-out process is complete. The URL is specified by the configuration parameter bordertech.wcomponents.logout.url. Note that this method is called after AbstractContainerHelper.invalidateSession(), so there may not be any session information available.
        Specified by:
        redirectForLogout in class AbstractContainerHelper

      • getResponseUrl

        protected String getResponseUrl(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Get the URL that responses should be directed to (ie, the URL in forms and hyperlinks). This is usually the same as the current request URL.
        Parameters:
        request - the incoming HttpServletRequest
        Returns:
        the URL that will be used in the form's action attribute and also in hyperlinks

      • getBaseUrl

        protected String getBaseUrl(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Get the base url that corresponds to this request. For instance, if the web application is mounted in the web context "evisas" on the server "localhost", and the request is for the URL "http://localhost/evisas/some/thing/page", then the returned base url will be "http://localhost/evisas".
        Parameters:
        request - the incoming request
        Returns:
        the base url for the web application.

      • addGenericHeaders

        protected void addGenericHeaders(UIContext uic,
                     WComponent ui)
        Subclasses can override this method to add extra headers. They can do this by obtaining the top ui component's WHeaders object and adding headers to it. Adding generic headers makes sense for servlets but maybe not portlets.
        Overrides:
        addGenericHeaders in class AbstractContainerHelper
        Parameters:
        uic - the current user context
        ui - the WComponent UI which is handling the request.

        Overrides:
        handleError in class AbstractContainerHelper
        Parameters:
        error - the error to handle.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error writing the error HTML.
